meta.title: doradolive
meta.description: 运筹帷幄之中，决胜于千里之外。
meta.author: Olivezq

pages.title: About
pages.text: About the author: Hello world! Actually there’s no much thing to talk about. But anyway. My name is Olive and this is my first personal site. I was born in 2006, an urban child. In 2021, I graduated from The Second Yu Ying Foreign Languages School of Nanjing and started my life in Jinling High School International Department A-Level Centre. Well that’s quite both two long names. I am a 70% INTJ and 30% ENTJ, according to MBTI. I am also a slytherclaw(both Slytherin and Ravenclaw). The reason I call this site “doradolive” is that it contains two names: dorado and olive. Dorado is a Spanish word meaning “golden”, also acts as a name for a marine fish with silver and bright blue coloration when alive. I also considered calling this site “ocellradolive” but that seemed too much. I took interest in Mathematics, Chinese, Economics, Computer Science and Linguistics. I’ll update this page if I want to change anything but for now, that’s all. Welcome. About the site: This site includes three parts and these parts are named under the name of “categories”. The first category is “Life”. It’s about my personal experiences, like some competitions I take part in, school life and a little bit of fiction writing. The second category is “IGCSE”. In this part, I updated several IGCSE subjects’s theory in a Chinese version, to make every Chinese students who study IGCSE have a better understanding of these subjects. I may also update videos, depending on my leisure time. The third category is “Becoming Rational”. I come up with thoughts about rationality and some philosophical point from time to time, so recording these thoughts needs to become a habbit so I can see whether I have improved. Some researches and investigations I did will also be updated here. All the posts are owned by me. Including the “IGCSE” category, because I made all the summaries and notes and videos and updates by myself. The whole site belongs to GitHub and Hexo and me, because GitHub and Hexo provide a site to be built, and I build this site all by myself. Welcome.

posts.title: IGCSE Physics Theory（中文版)
posts.text: Chapter 1 Making Measurements1.1 length&volume 测量工具：1） ruler 尺子 （e.g. metre ruler)测量注意点：（以wire为例）【4步】 straight，laid closely alongside end: cut neatly/ragged line one end of the wire up against the “0” look at the other end and read一定要注意测出来的是否可以保证正确2）游标卡尺 螺旋测微器游标：L=整的毫米数（主尺）+0.1*n毫米（游标） 测量方法1）measure sth. thin以测纸的厚度为例：【3步】 take a stack of 500 sheets measure its thickness devide by 5002）measure sth. curved以测弯曲的铁条为例：【3步】 lay a thread along the line mark the thread at either end lay it along a ruler3）measuring volumesi. cube/cuboid【3要素】 length width height=multiplyother regular shapes(spheres…):look up the equation for the volume ii. liquidsmeasuring cylinder 量筒beaker 烧杯look at the scale horizontally and read the level of the bottom of the meniscus(简单表达：eyes level with the scale)用最合适的量筒。e.g. 你不能用5ml的量筒测10mliii. measure bu displacement (for irregular objects) 【6步】 select a cylinder 3 or 4 times bigger than the object fill in water note V1 immerse the object in the water note V2 Vobject=V2-V1 国际单位：SI units：metre（m)1l=1dm^3 1ml=1cm^31deci(dm): 0.1m 1centi(cm):0.01m1mili(mm):0.001m 1micro(um):0.000001m1kilo~(km):1000m 1.2 Density 公式：Density (ρ)=Mass (m)/Volume (V)做题时m和V两个要素缺一不可 SI units: kg/m^3 密度的性质：1）Gas<solid/liquid2）任何在水面漂浮的物体密度都比水小。（e.g.冰）3）许多物质都有不同的密度（e.g.木头）4）水的密度：1*10^3kg/m^3, 1g/cm^35）immicible不溶中最上层的液体密度最小 1.3 Measuring Time 测量工具：analogue(指针）clockdigital(数字）clock (most precise） 测量方法：测量短时间：e.g.plumb bob单摆方法同1.1的2.1）相似 本章注意点 单位换算 各种物质的密度大小 特殊物体的m/v/ρ测量方法 读数 计算ρ=m/V图可以放大！ Chapter 2 Describing Motion2.1 Understanding Speed 公式：Speed(average)(v)=Total Distance(s)/​Total Time(t) SI units: m/s Speed in the laboratorylight gate法1: start the timer: peg attached to the trolley breaks the beam of one of the light gate stop the timer: breaks the second timer法2： mount an interrupt card(遮光片) on the trolley start the timer: the leading edge of the interrupt card breaks the beam stop the timer: the trailing edge passed the gate 2.2 Distance-time Graphs注意看清楚横轴和纵轴 2.3 Understanding Acceleration 定义：acceleration: 加速度the rate at which its speed is changing/the change in speed per unit time 性质：vector矢量 e.g.velocityscalar标量 e.g.speed 图像：speed-time graph the steeper the slope, the greater the acceleration a negative slope means a deceleration a horizontal graph(slope=0) meeans a constant speeddistance travelled=area under speed-time graph 2.4 Calculating Speed And Acceleration 公式： Acceleration (m/s)2=y2​−y1​​/x2​−x1​= Δv​/Δt 本章注意点 公式 实验（light gates） 图像的绘制，性质，相关计算 矢量和标量的区别

posts.title: My NEC DR Experience
posts.text: My NEC DR Experience Winter VocationThe story began before I go to high school.By accident, I met one of my new classmates who became our team leader in the end, and soon agreed to join his NEC team. At that time, I thought this was only one of the common things that I have to experience during high school, but I was wrong. It clearly brought me unique practical knowledge and feelings that no other incident can. LessonsNEC, short for National Economics Competition, is divided into three levels to choose from. The easiest level, suitable for PAL students like us, is called PRE. For students in AS and A2, they are asked to take higher levels, DR and AS, while AS the most difficult.Sonic, our leader, told us that his teacher advised him to compete DR. I was surprised at first because we had never studied Economics before, but I still accepted that option without giving it much thought.We soon regret. Everyone else in PAL signed for PRE and people who would compete with us were all from higher grades. But with much courage, we decided to try our best.Well, he who knows not fears not.To catch up our Economics, we attended several NEC courses outside school. We also joined our school’s Economics Club to receive further education.I always remember those nights. When everyone got their schoolbags and left the classroom, the three of us would travel far away to a plaza to study Economics, Sonic, Kevin and me. Crowded in a small room, where we learn about absolute advantages, tariffs, quotas, inflation and things like that. We learned both micro and macro at the same time, sometimes even international and current events, because we didn’t have time left.Those nights, after the lesson, I would leaned against the bus’s window, watching the streetlights passing. Thinking about the future which seemed to be so unclear. The Preliminary TestWe found the fourth teammate online. After all the preparation, the test was imminent, and we were more nervous than ever before.I double checked my computer’s camera which was working well and spent the whole Saturday and Sunday preparinng. Before the competition, my teammates sent several encouraging messages both to me and in the group which was touching.The test ended like it was no more than a normal test. Then we had another week waiting for our results anxiously. Results“Is the results coming out today?” I asked.Getting an affirmative answer, I took a deep breath.In the afternoon, when I was working on my GitHub, Sonic texted me in an urgent tone. Then I clicked on the “Bloom” icon, and saw the Chinese characters of “rise in rank”, red and big.It took me a while to realize what had just happended. I then thousands checked the results, clicking the “see results” icon again and again. My teammates exclaimed their joy in almost every social media, and the next few hours my computer was busy in replying congradulation messages.It was so unbelievable. So, so, so, unbelievable.We competed with people older than us, and we managed to win out more than a half of them. All beacause of our supportive parents, our respected teachers, and every hardworking member in our team.Our next stop would be Changsha, Hunan in March.And I think, the future is bright.Boom like a TNT.As Sonic claimed in our group’s description.

posts.title: good morning my honor
posts.text: Yet this is a test.GOOD MORNING MY HONOR!
